intro: Syngonanthus tenuis var. minor, commonly known as the slender mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It has small, oval-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in pairs along the stems. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its berries are usually red or orange, containing seeds that are dispersed by birds. This species is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments.
